messages.message: Hi all - @Barrie found this problem in our docs here https://www.instabase.com/docs/reference/apis/instabase-python-sdk/ that it is very confusing how to download our python SDK. I never use our Python SDK before - anyone here has experiences with it or know anything about it? Does it still work, and if so, where is it? cc a few people that i think might know @shaunak @Heymian @Ashish @Aaron Vontell @Jonathan Shih
Thanks for flagging @Kerry.  More context here from @Barrie’s JIRA ticket
Yeah I don’t really know the answer here. Waiting on others for help. If no one knows - let’s take it down, as the current doc doesn’t make sense
And if we do take it down - would love to know what we recommend to our developers on how to integrate with our APIs for their apps!  If it's "build your own in your language of choice", so be it

We can deprecate/delete it. It’s very outdated at this point and likely doesn’t match our actual code/sdk anymore. Anant added it in Jan of 2018 (and even updated the docs) but I’m not sure for what use case (tsk tsk  no checkin message).
Okay @Heymian that's easy to remove the outdated doc.
Great. So what is our recommendation for developers making an app on top of the Instabase platform @Heymian?
Make your own API calls in Java, JS, Python, etc. and parse the results yourself?  Do our docs provide enough API level detail to do this properly?
yup, our APIs are pretty detailed, especially around the platform-side of things like accessing files. Everyone relies on those, from companies to new students from a university class.
And if we find that they’re not clear enough, we should definitely add more verbiage to provide the details.

I moved the API docs Jira issue out of INSIGHTS and into IBG so we can immediately address the docs. Let's use PR https://github.com/instabase/instabase-docs/pull/184 to fix anything we can. I deleted the Instabase Python SDK (https://dogfood.instabase.com/docs/reference/apis/instabase-python-sdk/) document, what else can we improve? All feedback welcome.
